address: Glen Ellyn Hotel, 4 S Glenwood Ave
building_description: 3-story brick hotel labeled 'Glen Ellyn Hotel'. Adjacent to Village Hall and Funke Lumber. Includes porches and fire walls.
notes: Hotel appears prominently labeled; adjacent to Village Hall and retail stores. Likely a social and lodging hub of Glen Ellyn in the 1920s.
source: Library of Congress Sanborn Map Collection

address: Main St. & Crescent Blvd. retail block
building_description: Dense block of 1- and 2-story brick commercial stores including bakery, dry goods, tailor, and drug store. Multiple party walls between shops.
notes: Typical downtown mixed-use block. Many stores are labeled. Likely a primary retail corridor in 1929 Glen Ellyn.
source: Library of Congress Sanborn Map Collection

building_description: 2-story wood-frame residence with detached garage in the rear. Porch on the east side.
notes: Labeled as Lot 17 in the Bickerdike & Wilson's Subdivision. Situated on the northwest corner of Glenwood and Anthony.
source: Library of Congress Sanborn Map Collection

building_description: Single-story lumber yard and office complex. Multiple wood-frame sheds and storage buildings labeled Pickens-Blumbl Co.
notes: Large facility occupying the west side of Glenwood just south of Crescent. Includes lumber storage and office area. Likely a key industrial site in 1929 Glen Ellyn.
source: Library of Congress Sanborn Map Collection

building_description: 2-story stone church with attached rectory. Labeled 'Sacred Heart Church'. Gothic architectural elements visible.
notes: Located at northeast corner of Crescent and Forest Ave. Serves as a major landmark in the eastern part of the map.
source: Library of Congress Sanborn Map Collection
